alert.note: Alert for Ferry (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 23 at 5:38AM PDT until May 28 at 6:43AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew affecting Ferry County. .Rain and snowmelt will keep the Kettle River running high for the next several days. For the Kettle River...including Ferry above Curlew...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew. * WHEN...Until Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.7 feet, Water begins to impact State Route 21 near Little Goosemus Road at mile post 185. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:15 AM PDT Tuesday the stage was 18.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value slightly above 19.5 feet at times today and again Wednesday. - Flood stage is 18.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.7 feet on 06/01/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 545 PM PDT.
